TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed Compiler extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement
Public NotInheritable Class Compiler Inherits ConfigurationElement

summary.span: Defines a compiler that is used to support the compilation infrastructure of Web applications.

span.span: Defines a compiler that is used to support the compilation infrastructure of Web applications.
This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks La classe permet d’accéder par programmation à un élément de configuration du compilateur.The class provides a way to programmatically access a compiler configuration element.

MemberSignature.Value: public Compiler (string compilerOptions, string extension, string language, string type, int warningLevel);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string compilerOptions, string extension, string language, string type, int32 warningLevel) cil managed

public: Compiler(System::String ^ compilerOptions, System::String ^ extension, System::String ^ language, System::String ^ type, int warningLevel);
new System.Web.Configuration.Compiler : string * string * string * string * int -> System.Web.Configuration.Compiler
MemberSignature.Usage: new System.Web.Configuration.Compiler (compilerOptions, extension, language, type, warningLevel)

param.name: compilerOptions
param.span: Lists additional compiler-specific options to pass during compilation.

span.span: Lists additional compiler-specific options to pass during compilation.

param.name: extension
param.span: Provides a semicolon-separated list of file-name extensions used for dynamic code-behind files.

span.span: Provides a semicolon-separated list of file-name extensions used for dynamic code-behind files.
For example, ".cs".

param.name: language
param.span: Provides a semicolon-separated list of languages used in dynamic compilation files.

span.span: Provides a semicolon-separated list of languages used in dynamic compilation files.
For example, "c#;cs;csharp".

param.name: type
param.span: Specifies a comma-separated class/assembly combination that indicates the .NET Framework class.

span.span: Specifies a comma-separated class/assembly combination that indicates the .NET Framework class.
Specifies compiler warning levels.

summary.span: Creates an instance of a initialized to the provided values.

span.span: Creates an instance of a initialized to the provided values.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CompilerOptions As String
public: property System::String ^ CompilerOptions { System::String ^ get(); };

summary.span: Gets a list of compiler-specific options to use during compilation.

span.span: Gets a list of compiler-specific options to use during compilation.

value.span: Valeur spécifiant les options spécifiques au compilateur à utiliser pendant la compilation.

span.span: A value specifying the compiler-specific options to use during compilation.

value.span: Cela n’est pas un jeu fusionné mais plutôt remplace toutes les valeurs précédemment définies dans les entrées de configuration antérieures.

span.span: This is not a merged set but rather overrides any previously defined values in earlier configuration entries.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Extension As String
public: property System::String ^ Extension { System::String ^ get(); };

summary.span: Gets a list of file-name extensions used for dynamic code-behind files.

span.span: Gets a list of file-name extensions used for dynamic code-behind files.

value.span: Valeur qui spécifie les extensions de nom de fichier utilisées pour les fichiers code-behind dynamiques, les fichiers dans le répertoire de code et l’autre des fichiers référencés.

span.span: A value specifying the file-name extensions used for dynamic code-behind files, files in the code directory, and other referenced files.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Lorsque la liste des extensions de nom de fichier inclut plusieurs extensions, la liste est délimitée par des points-virgules.When the list of file-name extensions includes more than one extension, the list is semicolon-separated.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Language As String
public: property System::String ^ Language { System::String ^ get(); };

summary.span: Gets a list of programming languages to use in dynamic compilation files.

span.span: Gets a list of programming languages to use in dynamic compilation files.

value.span: Valeur spécifiant les langages de programmation à utiliser dans les fichiers de compilation dynamique.

span.span: A value specifying the programming languages to use in dynamic compilation files.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Lorsque la liste des langages de programmation inclut plusieurs langues, la liste est délimitée par des points-virgules.When the list of programming languages includes more than one language, the list is semicolon-separated.

summary.span: Gets the compiler type name of the language provider for dynamic compilation files.

span.span: Gets the compiler type name of the language provider for dynamic compilation files.

value.span: Valeur spécifiant le nom de type du compilateur de langage à utiliser dans les fichiers de compilation dynamique.

span.span: A value specifying the type name of the language compiler to use in dynamic compilation files.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Spécifie le nom de type du fournisseur de langage, y compris le nom de l’assembly contenant l’implémentation du fournisseur.Specifies the type name of the language provider, including the name of the assembly containing the provider implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property WarningLevel As Integer
public: property int WarningLevel { int get(); };

span.span: Gets the compiler warning level.

value.span: Valeur spécifiant le niveau d’avertissement du compilateur.

span.span: A value specifying the compiler warning level.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Spécifie le niveau d’avertissement du compilateur par défaut ; Détermine le niveau auquel le fournisseur de langage traite les avertissements de compilation comme des erreurs.Specifies the default compiler warning level; determines the level at which the language provider treats compilation warnings as errors.
